text: person unaccounted for during platform alarm at approximately 10:30am on tuesday december 11th 2018. a complete platform alarm was raised in response to an emergency shutdown button being activated. personnel on the platform abandoned ampa06 via the gangway to jack up vessel, blue titanium.prior to personnel crossing the gangway they removed their t-card on the ap platform from the platform side t-card rack to the blue titanium side t-card rack to indicatethat they had left the platform. similarly, once on board blue titanium, the personnel removed their t-cards from the platform side to the blue titanium side to indicate thatthey were now on board blue titanium.after about 15 minutes from the alarm initially sounding it became apparent that all personnel except for one had changed their t-card on blue titanium. rope access technician.the amec fw pms superintendent then returned to ap platform to check the t-card rack there and discovered that the same person had also failed to turn his t-card there as well.due to this, it was decided to hold a full muster on board blue titanium and a search conducted on board for the unaccounted person. unaccounted persons work mates were consulted and they confirmed that he had been working with them earlier on the platform at amcp. bsp csr contacted the operators on board ampa06 to inform them that a person was unaccounted for.at about 11:30 the missing person was found by the operators (wops) on amcp. the wops escorted the missing person across the platform to blue titanium. he was later transferred back to shore where he undertook a drug test which returned a preliminary non negative result. formal result to be advised.

a disgruntled person spreaking ill-mannered to receptionist. a disgruntled person appeared in reception area and was being belligerent while the receptionist was speaking on the phone. the receptionist asked him to leave and advised him that she would have to call security. the individual left the area.  the incident was reported to the building management and relevant amec foster wheeler personnel. the interim protocol for responding to the security issues at the reception was re-etirated once again to the receptionist untill more formal procedure is established.

while transporting newly received paint on a trolley, the paint container dropped from trolley and it was reported about two litres of paint spilled on plant access road. migrated from legacy cairs incident #36423on 12th february 2018 around 10.30am upon receiving paints from a lorry, mechanical helper placed 10 number of paints stored in each 5 litres container onto a large trolley. the paint containers were each placed without stacking one another on the trolley. while pushing the trolley on plant access road to the storage area, one of the trolley wheel had rolled over a small granite aggregate and thereby causing one of the paint container to dropped off from the trolley and causing a spillage of about 2 litres on plant access road. the mechanical helper then immediately scooped the spilt paint into another empty container while the rest of the residual balance spillage on the plant access road was applied with absorbent pad. the paint did not spill into the nearby perimeter drain and it leaves about 1m2 area of stain on the plant access road. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

three (03) workers felt unwell during concrete casting of a 46m3 pump pad slab.  three (03) workers felt unwell during concrete casting of a 46m3 pump pad slab. the workers were transported to the project related clinic and received first aid care level assistance.  they received oral administered isotonic drinks for hydration the workers were transported to the project related clinic and received first aid care level assistance.  they received oral administered isotonic drinks for hydration.  all other workers at that location was replaced with other workers to finish the last truck concreting works

a wood employee has been tested positive to covid-19 a wood employee has been tested positive to covid-19. she was working from home since 12th october. no contact tracing has been necessary. no action required as she was working from home since 12th october.

a technician stopped his job after discovering fibres in an old bitumen type coating on a pipe he was abrasive blasting inside a digester tank. sample taken and exclusion zone set up, investigation completed. migrated from legacy cairs incident #39752a dry blasting technician removing pipe coatings inside the digester noticed possible asbestos containing materials in the coating as it was being removed. a sample was tested and fount to contain chystolite asbestos. due to the potential for airborne fibres the works have been stopped and the area around the digester has been cordoned off. air monitoring & surface swab testing have commenced. investigation completed by both mw & wood, as attached. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: mechanical or equipment issue, vehicle incident general
text: ready mix truck coming into contact with optic cable. no damage sustained to cable. lrm concrete truck driver drove pass the contractor gate 3 to make a u turn in order to discharge concrete for the newly installed turnstiles. during his u turn, the top of the concrete truck came into contact with an overhead cable. there was no damage to the cable. cdm to raise cables accordingly for tmm to pass under.

employee tested positive for covid-19 the employee is considered positive for covid-19 by local health authorities having had close contact with his daughter tested positive for covid-19. he is quarantined at home due to mild symptoms and is being monitored by his medical coverage. has not had close contact with other wood employees, clients, or subcontractor due to the easter holiday.  the employee works from home regularly. employee is in quarantine as per health ministry of autonomous city of buenos aires guidelines

managed contractor tested positive for covid-19 managed contractor tested positive for covid-19, via a pcr test. this is understood to be community transmission.  individual entered self isolation period, as per government guidance.

category: general injury, hand or arm injury, vehicle incident general, foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: ip struck his elbow against the airframe of the helicopter he was alighting from migrated from legacy cairs incident #34596ip struck his elbow against the airframe of the helicopter he was alighting from. he contacted the platform medic who advised him to return if his condition worsened. he completed his 2 week trip offshore and demobilised on his normal crew change day.note: late entry due to late notification from the client migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

employee rear ended on route to troxler lab for equipment calibration., minor neck pain the following day.  wood employee was transporting two densometers to troxler lab for calibration. during transportation (hwy 401 eb) woodâ€™s fleet vehicle was rear-ended by another vehicle attempting to change lanes in stopped traffic. driver reported minor neck pain the next day and instructed to contact workcare. both drivers pulled to the side of the road to asses damage and exchange insurance.  incident was reported to the crso, who in turn notified the hsse director.  a survey meter was dispatched to scan the gauges, per emergency response procedures, and it was determined that there was no radiation detected that was outside of normal ranges, gauges were returned to licensed storage location that day.  the cnsc duty officer was notified of the mva involving the nuclear devices.

three employees gemont tested positive to covid-19 three employees tested positive for covid-19 during routine checks ordered by the client (evonik). workers and their close contacts (54 co-workers that share the same building, room, flat or shuttle in gelsenkirchen, marl and mulheim) were immediately sent in quarantine. no other consequences.

wood employee tested positive for covid (lft)  tested positive lft on the sat 5th feb but worked from accommodation for the rest of his time off, came back to work on the 15th feb 2022 after 2 negative lft tests on the 13th feb & 14th feb 2022 sayed and worked in lodge accommodation  and completed 2 negative lft tests before returning back to work on 15th february 2022

silted water is evident in the craig burn and tributary below the access track.  silted water is evident in the craig burn and tributary below the access track crossing culverts. further investigation and any appropriate mitigation procedures will be carried out.   mitigation plan devised

category: foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: injured party felt a pain in their left knee. wood welder completed a weld run and turned and stepped back to walk away from the job, whilst doing so the ip felt a pain in their left knee. the ip was stood in an upright position whilst undertaking the task and did not strike against / into any object whilst carrying out this motion. the housekeeping in the immediate area was of a good standard with no trip hazards present. there were no issues with the  floor / ground condition.  the ip alerted his immediate supervisor. the client's onsite emergency responders were called and the ip was given first aid treatment, a support bandage was applied. the ip was advised to attend the local a&e and was transported there by a member of the wood site management team.
one wood employee tested positive for covid-19  one wood employee tested positive for covid-19 one wood employee tested positive for covid-19 while at home

a wood group lease operator was brushed on his cheek by a well hut door that fell off causing a small abrasion.  axiom was called.  first aid only. migrated from legacy cairs incident #33491the wood group lease operator was opening the fiberglass well hut door at the cgu fed 11-3-5078 location. as he was pulling the 3ft wide by 4ft tall door to himself, the door fell off the hut toward him. he jumped back, but the door brushed his right cheek causing a small abrasion. he cleansed the area, applied ointment and a band-aide. he called hse to report the incident. axiom was called and a nurse gave the ip first aid measures to follow. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

subcontractor communicated a late positive confirmation for covid-19 to site management. subcontractor reported a confirmed positive test for covid-19. the subcontractor employee was placed in isolation.  subcontractor/wood identified those who may have worked in proximity.  appropriate notifications have been completed. there were total of 17 cases reported by this contractor.

ip tested positive for covid-19 (symptomatic), reported from home.  ip working remotely from home, however, ip reported that flu symptoms developed therefore requested a pcr test. woodkss hsse department arranged a pcr test, test result came positive for covid-19. no close contact people were identified.  ip instructed to selfisolate for 14 days, woodkss management notified.
close contact of positive case individual was identified as a close contact- asymptomatic. isolated in his room for the next ten days

employee hit a pile with his bucket while digging ee was digging next to a pile when he swung his bucket and made contact with the pile.  operator stopped work and alerted his supervisor. company policy will be followed.

category: head or face injury, general illness or health issue
text: ee had a fall in the hallway due to feeling light headed after having bloodwork drawn.  axiom contacted ee; determined a personal condition and not work related. migrated from legacy cairs incident #36144joe warren fall.e-mail from jodi capps to james branham and mark nussbaum.hi james,just wanted to let you know that joe warren had a fall in the hallway due to having bloodwork done he was a little light headed. mark has confirmed with him that he is fine and was just a little woozy due to the bloodwork. please let us know if we need to do anything further regarding this.thank you!jodi cappsexecutive assistant, onshore field services17325 park rowhouston, tx 77084office:832.809.8905cell: 281.384.2522jodi.capps@woodplc.comwww.woodplc.comjb contacted ee and determined he did not hit his head; ee explained that this has occurred throughout his life and he knows how to roll to the ground when feeling dizzy. as follow-up, axiom contacted ee and determinedthat ee condition was a personal medical condition, was ok to stay at work and did not require additional assessment. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

lower back strain employee reported discomfort in lower back after lifting a 3-ton come-a-long on scaffold. employee stated that the incident happened at 8 am on 1-16-20, however he did not report it to his supervisor until near the end of shift. ie was evaluated, treated, and released back to work without restrictions by the on-site medic.

category: hand or arm injury, knife incident
text: employee cut his left thumb with a retractable knife while cutting a piece of rubber flooring. migrated from legacy cairs incident #36382employee was cutting a piece of rubber flooring using a retractable razor knife. he placed the knife along a straight edge and as he pulled the knife along to cut the rubber it snagged. he applied additional pressure forcing the knife to move then lost control cutting across the top of his left thumb. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

road traffic accident that led to fatal injuries for the driver (non wood employee ) and minor injuries to wood employee  non work related incident on 31st january at approx. 7pm  a vehicle carrying a wood employee and driven by a friend of the employee suffered an accident that led to fatal injuries for the driver and minor injuries for the wood employee .

category: foot or leg injury, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: damage to aerial lift hydraulic tray (cradle)			 employee was descending pr 1 in an aerial lift when the hydraulic tray (cradle) on the boom contacted a vertical scaffold leg, causing minor damage to the tray. the scaffold was unoccupied at the time of incident.			 incident was reported and the employee was taken to the on-site pa for post incident screening. aerial lift was taken out of service. scaffold was also taken out of service until deemed safe to use by scaffold contractor. investigation initiated.

backhoe hydraulic hose contention failed resulting in 5l hydraulic fluid to soil whilst conducting  a voc on the backhoe asset n#ppe097, a hydraulic hose contention failed resulting in approximately 5l hydraulic fluid leaking to soil.  contaminated material removed for disposal.  maintenance to inspect the backhoe and repair

hand digging around exposed unidentified cables highlighted that the recently drilled pile (no15) missed the cables by approx 75mm during excavation a number of unidentified power cables were exposed. the final exposure of the cables was controlled by hand digging. as no-one could be 100% certain that the cables were dead the decision was made to spike the cables to guarantee that they were dead. to be able to do this further hand digging was required to expose more cable for the spiking activity, it was at this time it was observed that one of our recently drilled piles missed the cable by 75mm.   all excavation and hand digging was stopped. spiking of the cables was completed on monday morning (26th sept) and the near loss investigation has commenced on the same afternoon, once the spiking result had confirmed that the cables were dead. all of the subject cables were protected by concrete slab/tiles/clay ducts.

(2) ips displaying signs of viral infection  received communication from production manager that (2) hexagon personnel were showing signs of a viral infection (chills/fever) and the decision was made to send them onshore for evaluation and treatment and to prevent further employees from contracting illness  personnel removed from platform and sent to la paz for further evaluation

injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker a summer employee was tasked with weed whacking brush on a hill at the amusement area.  he slipped while mowing the hill and severed the tips of three toes.  he was hospitalized where surgery was performed to repair the toes.

pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee was injured while operating a pallet jack at doyle's wholesale. the pallet jack ran over the employee's foot, requiring reconstructive surgery.
